justification: Fails to model B’s consensus-driven, rookie/upside preferences; asks B to give up a Tier 2 breakout WR with a friendly playoff slate for a Tier 3 Q-tag possession WR and a worse RB. Minimal separation of A vs. B incentives and ignores B’s playoff-schedule focus (which favors keeping Torres). Trade value is lopsided and p_accept is overstated. Rationale is generic and not grounded in tiers, roles, or injury context.
